full_summary:
### Tender Appointment

**Tender Title:** Request for Abbreviated Proposals (RFAP) for Environmental Consulting Services

**Tender Reference:** NR23SL01_81055

**Description:** Defence Construction Canada (DCC) invites consulting firms to submit abbreviated proposals for the establishment of a Source List (SL) to provide contaminated sites, environmental compliance, and designated substance and hazardous materials consulting services, on an “as and when required” basis, for the Department of National Defence (DND) in Nunavut.

**Objective:** This RFAP aims to select two (2) firms to be placed on the SL, with a maximum estimated value of $2,000,000.00 for a period of one (1) year from the establishment of the SL. The SL may be extended for up to two (2) additional one-year periods, subject to the consultant being an Inuit Firm that is still registered and in good standing on the Inuit Firm Registry, and mutual agreement between the consultant and DCC.

**Trade Agreements:** This procurement is subject to the Agreement Between the Inuit of the Nunavut Settlement Area and Her Majesty the Queen in Right of Canada (the Nunavut Agreement) and the Treasury Board of Canada Secretariat’s Directive on Government Contracts (including real property leases) in the Nunavut Settlement Area.

**Eligibility:** Bidding for this solicitation is restricted to qualified Inuit Firms that are registered and in good standing with the Inuit Firm Registry.

**Bidding Documentation:** The tender documents, including the RFAP, are available on Merx (http://www.merx.com).

**Selection Criteria:** The evaluation will be based on the established criteria in the RFAP, including Inuit and Nunavut benefits for Inuit employment, Inuit training and skills development, subcontracting to Inuit firms, and the location of offices/facilities in the Nunavut Settlement Area.

**Contact Information:**

* Steve Kennedy, Defence Construction Canada
* Phone: 613-769-2659
* Email: [steve.kennedy@dcc-cdc.gc.ca](mailto:steve.kennedy@dcc-cdc.gc.ca)
* Website: Defence Construction Canada (dcc-cdc.gc.ca)

### Service Requirements

The following services are required:

* Senior and Intermediate Professionals for Contaminated Sites, Environmental Compliance, and Designated Substance and Hazardous Materials Consulting
* Project Managament
* Senior and Intermediate Environmental Engineers
*
